page.title: 08ULNABY HALL FARM
page.content: Ulnaby Hall is a farm of four hundred acres, situated to the south of Walworth at grid reference 226173, at the junction of the B6279 and the road leading to Walworth,approximately one mile to the north. The farm's buildings are situated adjacent to the site of the{deserted {village}of Ulnaby. All that can be seen of this formerly sizeable settlement today are a series of grass covered hummocks, now grazed by cattle.This can be contrasted with the nearby village of Walworth, which was merely reduced in size, not totally deserted during population contractions of the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries. The farm is held by a group of {trustees,}as are four other local farms.
